title: Network Intrusion Analysis
description: A network intrusion has been detected. Analyze network logs and system files to understand the attack timeline and methods used.

scenario.briefing: Critical Alert: Our network monitoring systems detected unusual traffic patterns and potential data exfiltration. Multiple systems appear to have been compromised through a sophisticated attack chain. You need to trace the attack from initial compromise to data theft and identify all affected systems.
scenario.objective: Reconstruct the attack timeline, identify the entry point, and determine what data was stolen.

02:13 - Web shell uploaded via admin panel
1. Initial Access: SSH brute force â†’ webadmin account
4. Lateral Movement: SSH to database server
6. Exfiltration: HTTPS transfer to C2 server
- Financial records and credit card data
- Protocol: HTTPS beacon with base64 encoding
- Tool: Custom web shell + Cobalt Strike beacon

clues.title: Initial Compromise
clues.description: The attack began with a brute force attack against SSH services.
clues.hint: Check authentication logs for failed and successful login attempts

clues.title: Web Shell Deployment
clues.description: A malicious web shell was uploaded to maintain persistence.
clues.hint: Look at web server access logs and uploaded files

clues.title: Command and Control
clues.description: The malware established communication with an external C2 server.
clues.hint: Examine network monitoring logs for suspicious beacon activity

clues.title: Lateral Movement
clues.description: The attacker moved from the web server to the database server.
clues.hint: Check command history and network logs for connections between internal systems

clues.title: Database Compromise
clues.description: Sensitive database information was accessed and stolen.
clues.hint: Look at MySQL logs for database queries and dump operations

clues.title: Data Exfiltration
clues.description: Large amounts of data were transferred to the attacker's servers.
clues.hint: Check network logs for large file transfers and uploads

steps: Identify the initial SSH brute force attack from 203.0.113.45
Trace successful login as webadmin user
Discover web shell upload through admin panel
Follow privilege escalation to root access
Track lateral movement to database server via SSH
Analyze database queries showing data enumeration
Identify data exfiltration through C2 communication
Calculate total scope of compromised data
solution.explanation: Multi-stage attack: SSH brute force â†’ web shell â†’ privilege escalation â†’ lateral movement â†’ database theft â†’ data exfiltration. Attacker stole 156MB of sensitive data including 45,000 customer records, financial data, and system credentials through sophisticated C2 infrastructure.
